results.title: Simvastatin, edaravone and dexamethasone protect against kainate-induced brain endothelial cell damage
results.text_hl: Our results confirmed the potential clinical usefulness of these drugs to attenuate @<m>DISEASE_Glut1_Deficiency_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C536830 @@@BBB damage@@@.

citations.NLM: Barna L, Walter FR, Harazin A, Bocsik A, Kincses A, Tubak V, Jósvay K, Zvara Á, Campos-Bedolla P, Deli MA. Simvastatin, edaravone and dexamethasone protect against kainate-induced brain endothelial cell damage Fluids Barriers CNS. 2020 Feb 10;17(1):5. PMID: 32036791
citations.BibTeX: @article{32036791, title={Simvastatin, edaravone and dexamethasone protect against kainate-induced brain endothelial cell damage}, author={Barna L and Walter FR and Harazin A and Bocsik A and Kincses A and Tubak V and Jósvay K and Zvara Á and Campos-Bedolla P and Deli MA}, journal={Fluids Barriers CNS}, volume={17}, number={1}, pages={5}}

results.title: Simvastatin treatment in surgically induced brain injury in rats.
results.text_hl: The objective of this study was to evaluate whether @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ reduces @DISEASE_Brain_Edema @DISEASE_MESH:D001929 @@@brain edema@@@ by preventing @<m>DISEASE_Glut1_Deficiency_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C536830 @@@BBB disruption@@@ and improves neurologic status after surgically-induced @DISEASE_Brain_Injuries @DISEASE_MESH:D001930 @@@brain injury@@@ (@DISEASE_Brain_Injuries @DISEASE_MESH:D001930 @@@SBI@@@).

citations.NLM: Lee S, Jadhav V, Lekic T, Hyong A, Allard M, Stier G, Martin R, Zhang J. Simvastatin treatment in surgically induced brain injury in rats. Acta Neurochir Suppl. 2008;102():401-4. PMID: 19388355
citations.BibTeX: @article{19388355, title={Simvastatin treatment in surgically induced brain injury in rats.}, author={Lee S and Jadhav V and Lekic T and Hyong A and Allard M and Stier G and Martin R and Zhang J}, journal={Acta Neurochir Suppl}, volume={102}, pages={401-4}}

results.title: Simvastatin reduces secondary brain injury caused by cortical contusion in rats: possible involvement of TLR4/NF-kappaB pathway.
results.text_hl: Administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ following @DISEASE_Brain_Injuries_Traumatic @DISEASE_MESH:D000070642 @@@TBI@@@ significantly ameliorated the secondary @DISEASE_Brain_Damage_Chronic @DISEASE_MESH:D001925 @@@brain damage@@@, such as cortical apoptosis, @DISEASE_Brain_Edema @DISEASE_MESH:D001929 @@@brain edema@@@, blood-brain @<m>DISEASE_Glut1_Deficiency_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C536830 @@@barrier (BBB)@@@ impairment, and @DISEASE_Neurologic_Manifestations @DISEASE_MESH:D009461 @@@motor deficits@@@.

citations.NLM: Chen G, Zhang S, Shi J, Ai J, Qi M, Hang C. Simvastatin reduces secondary brain injury caused by cortical contusion in rats: possible involvement of TLR4/NF-kappaB pathway. Exp Neurol. 2009 Apr;216(2):398-406. PMID: 19166837
citations.BibTeX: @article{19166837, title={Simvastatin reduces secondary brain injury caused by cortical contusion in rats: possible involvement of TLR4/NF-kappaB pathway.}, author={Chen G and Zhang S and Shi J and Ai J and Qi M and Hang C}, journal={Exp Neurol}, volume={216}, number={2}, pages={398-406}}

results.title: Statins Protect the Blood Brain Barrier Acutely after Experimental Intracerebral Hemorrhage.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: MRI data for animals receiving @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treatment showed significantly reduced @<m>DISEASE_Glut1_Deficiency_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C536830 @@@BBB dysfunction@@@ and improved CBF in the @DISEASE_Cerebral_Hemorrhage @DISEASE_MESH:D002543 @@@ICH@@@ rim compared to controls (P<0.05) 4 days after @DISEASE_Cerebral_Hemorrhage @DISEASE_MESH:D002543 @@@ICH@@@.

citations.NLM: Yang D, Knight RA, Han Y, Karki K, Zhang J, Chopp M, Seyfried DM. Statins Protect the Blood Brain Barrier Acutely after Experimental Intracerebral Hemorrhage. J Behav Brain Sci. 2013 Feb;3(1):100-106. PMID: 23459792
citations.BibTeX: @article{23459792, title={Statins Protect the Blood Brain Barrier Acutely after Experimental Intracerebral Hemorrhage.}, author={Yang D and Knight RA and Han Y and Karki K and Zhang J and Chopp M and Seyfried DM}, journal={J Behav Brain Sci}, volume={3}, number={1}, pages={100-106}}
